message.content:
cs.IT, cs.CR, cs.DS, cs.CC, cs.SE 

The paper deals with the secure storage of noisy data, which is a topic that falls under the sub-category of information theory (cs.IT). The use of error correcting codes is a common technique in this area, which suggests that the paper may also be relevant to the sub-category of cryptography (cs.CR). The paper also mentions burst errors, which are a type of error that occurs in data transmission and storage, indicating that the paper may be relevant to the sub-category of data structures (cs.DS). Additionally, the paper proposes new constructions for burst error correction, which suggests that it may also be relevant to the sub-category of computational complexity (cs.CC). Finally, the paper deals with the security of stored data, which is a topic that falls under the sub-category of software engineering (cs.SE).
